oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kye Fleming & Dennis L. Morgan Interview by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Kye Fleming & Dennis L. Morgan. The interview takes place on 12-9-80.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kye Fleming; Dennis L. Morgan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:10) -- Kye Fleming describes the advantages of being hired to a company as a songwriter. (0:50) -- John Lomax asks Kye Fleming for advice for women getting into songwriting. (2:31) -- Kye Fleming speaks about the prejudices against women in songwriting. (3:04) -- John Lomax asks Kye Fleming and Dennis L. Morgan about advice they might have for newer Nashville songwriters. (4:22) -- Dennis L. Morgan speaks about the advantages of trying to write one amazing song instead of several awful ones. (5:42) -- Dennis L. Morgan speaks about the paradoxical nature of writing songs when trying to find a great tune. (6:29) -- John Lomax asks Dennis L. Morgan and Kye Fleming about their planned cuts for other artists. (7:44) -- Kye Fleming and Dennis L. Morgan discuss writing for Sylvia. (8:02) -- John Lomax asks about several of Kye Fleming's and Dennis L. Morgan's hits. (10:07) -- John Lomax asks about Kye Fleming and Dennis L. Morgan's composing methods. They both write songs on guitar, sometimes piano. (10:52) -- Dennis L. Morgan discuss the difficulty of playing gigs while songwriting at a high capacity. (13:30) -- Dennis L. Morgan describes writing songs while in the car.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Fleming, Kye; Morgan, Dennis, 1952-;
